P.HT: Reporting template for managers of Money Market Funds (MMFs)

GR.SEQ.P: Except where otherwise specified, all figures shall be filled in at sub-fund level

NOTE.P: Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 14 June 2017 on money market funds

Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/61 of 10 October 2014 to supplement Regulation (EU) No 575/2013 of the European Parliament and the Council with regard to liquidity coverage requirement for Credit Institutions (OJ L 11, 17.1.2015, p. 1).
The currency of the notional amount. In the case of an interest rate derivative contract, this will be the notional currency of leg 1.
The currency of the notional amount. In the case of an interest rate derivative contract, this will be the notional currency of leg 2.
If the MMF receives as collateral different assets within the meaning of Article 15(6) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131, the outcome should be reported for each asset.
Directive 2014/65/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 15 May 2014 on markets in financial instruments and amending Directive 2002/92/EC and Directive 2011/61/EU

TXT.HT: General characteristics, identification of the MMF and the manager of that MMF

ROW.CELL: National code of the MMF as provided by the competent authority of the MMF
ISO 17442 Legal Entity Identifier 20 alphanumerical character code (LEI)
ECB code (MFI ID code) of the MMF
Indicate if the MMF is a UCITS or an AIF

Indicate if the MMF is marketed solely through employee saving schemes governed by national law and which have natural persons as investors (in accordance with Art 16(5) of the Regulation (EU) 2017/1131
Member State where the MMF is authorised
Member States where the MMF is marketed
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
National code of the manager of the MMF as provided by the competent authority of the MMF
National code of the manager of the MMF as provided by the competent authority of the manager of the MMF
LEI of the manager of the MMF
ECB code (MFI ID code) of the manager of the MMF
Name of the manager of the MMF
Country where the manager of the MMF is authorized
LEI of the depositary of the MMF
National code of the depositary of the MMF
Legal name of the depositary of the MMF

NP.TXT: Master/feeder information (MMF marketed solely through employee savings scheme governed by national law and which has natural persons as investors)

ROW.CELL: If the MMF complies with the conditions of Article 16(5) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131, indicate whether the MMF is a master or a feeder fund [Select one]
If the MMF is a feeder:
LEI of the master of the MMF
National code of the master of the MMF
Legal name of the master of the MMF
Indicate whether the MMF has share classes
Where the MMF has share classes, state the single ISIN of the different share classes
Where the MMF has share classes, state the currency of the different share classes

TXT.HT: Information on preceding fund or liquidation (one-off reporting)

ROW.CELL: If the MMF has been merged with another fund, please indicate:
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
if the MMF is being liquidated, please indicate:
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD

TXT.HT: Total value of assets (for the purpose of the reporting template under the MMF Regulation, it is considered that the total value of assets equals the NAV – please see below field A.4.1)

ROW.CELL: Net asset value of the MMF (subfund level)
(EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Net asset value of the MMF
Weighted Average Maturity of the MMF calculated as set out in Article 2(19) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131.
Weighted Average Life of the MMF calculated as set out in Articles 2(20), 24(1)(b), 25(1)(b) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131.
% of assets qualifying for the daily liquidity buffer (daily maturing assets as defined under Articles 24 and 25 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131)
% of assets qualifying for the weekly liquidity buffer (weekly maturing assets as defined under Articles 24 and 25 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131)
Percentage of portfolio capable of being liquidated that fall within each period
Calendar year performance (net return) of the most representative share class
Monthly portfolio volatility and Monthly portfolio volatility of the shadow NAV (when applicable)

TXT.HT: Results of the stress tests of the MMF

ROW.CELL: Results of the liquidity stress tests of the MMF conducted within the reporting period as set out in Art 28(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and the corresponding ESMA guidelines on stress tests scenarios

Results of the credit stress tests of the MMF conducted within the reporting period as set out in Art 28(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and the corresponding ESMA guidelines on stress tests scenarios

Results of the FX rate stress tests of the MMF conducted within the reporting period as set out in Art 28(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and the corresponding ESMA guidelines on stress tests scenarios

Results of the Interest rate stress tests of the MMF conducted within the reporting period as set out in Art 28(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and the corresponding ESMA guidelines on stress tests scenarios

Results of stress test on the level of redemption of the MMF conducted within the reporting period as set out in Art 28(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and the corresponding ESMA guidelines on stress tests scenarios

Results of stress test of the MMF on the spread among indices to which interest rate of portfolio securities are tied conducted within the reporting period as set out in Art 28(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and the corresponding ESMA guidelines on stress tests scenarios
Results of the macro stress test of the MMF conducted within the reporting period as set out in Art 28(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and the corresponding ESMA guidelines on stress tests scenarios

Results of the multivariate stress test of the MMF conducted within the reporting period as set out in Art 28(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 and the corresponding ESMA guidelines on stress tests scenarios

In the case of CNAV and LVNAV MMFs, indicate the results of the stress tests mentioned in the fields A.5.1 to A.5.8 in terms of difference between the constant NAV per unit or share and the NAV per unit or share
Indicate the proposed action plan as set out in Art 28(4) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131

TXT.HT: Information on the assets held in the portfolio of the MMF
Money market instruments, eligible securitisations and asset backed commercial papers

CELL.HT: The below fields A.6 shall be completed using a line-by-line reporting template

ROW.CELL: Type of the Money market instrument, eligible securitisations and asset backed commercial papers [Select one or several]
Indicate the type of money market instruments, eligible securitisations and asset backed commercial papers

CELL.P: Money market instruments under Article 10 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131
Securitisations referred to in Article 13 of Commission Delegated Regulation (EU) 2015/61
ABCPs as referred to in Art 11(1)(b) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131
A simple, transparent and standardised securitisation or ABCP as referred to in Art 11(1)(c) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131

CELL.HT: If the type of asset is a money market instrument, complete the fields A.6.2 to A.6.20

ROW.CELL: Asset description of the money market instrument
ISIN of the money market instrument
CFI (if available, and if the ISIN is not available) of the money market instrument

CELL.P: The issuer categories shall be selected among the corresponding ones [Select one]
EU Public body (except National Public body)

ROW.CELL: Country of the issuer of the money market instrument
Maturity date of the money market instrument
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
Currency of the money market instrument
Quantity of the money market instrument
Clean price of the money market instrument
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Clean Price of the money market instrument
(in base currency, if A.6.14 is in EUR)
Total market value of the money market instrument
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Total market value of the money market instrument
Method used to price the money market instrument
Indicate whether the outcome of the internal credit assessment procedure is favourable or unfavourable
Provide the next interest rate reset date (as mentioned in Art 10(2) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131)
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD

CELL.HT: If the type of asset is an eligible securitisation or asset backed commercial paper, complete the fields A.6.21 to A.6.37

ROW.CELL: Asset description of the eligible securitisation or asset backed commercial paper
ISIN of the eligible securitisation or asset backed commercial paper
Country of the sponsor of the eligible securitisation and asset backed commercial paper
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
(in base currency, if A.6.30 is in EUR)
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Method used to price the eligible securitisations or asset backed commercial paper
Whether the outcome of the internal credit assessment procedure is favourable/unfavourable

CELL.P: Type of the Other assets [Select one]
The type of other assets shall be selected among the assets listed in Article 9 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131
Deposits with credit institutions as referred to in Article 12 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131
Reverse repurchase agreements as referred to in Article 15 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131
Repurchase agreements as referred to in Article 14 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131
Units or shares of other MMFs as referred to in Article 16 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131
Financial derivative instruments as referred to in Article 13 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 of which:

ITEM.P: Financial derivative instruments dealt in on a regulated market (and specify if it falls under Article 50(1)(a), (b) or (c) of Directive 2009/65/EC)

CELL.P: Ancillary liquid assets (in accordance with Article 50(2) of Directive 2009/65/EC)

CELL.HT: If the type of other asset is a financial derivative instrument, complete the fields A.6.39 to A.6.60

ROW.CELL: ISIN of the financial derivative instrument
UPI of the financial derivative instrument (if the ISIN is not available)
FISN (Financial Instrument Short Name) of the financial derivative instrument
CFI code (if available and if the ISIN is not available) of the financial derivative instrument
Type of derivative instrument set out in Article 13(a) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 [select one]

CELL.P: For underlying identification type I: ISO 6166 ISIN 12 character alphanumerical code
For underlying identification type X: ISO 6166 ISIN 12 character alphanumerical code if available, otherwise full name of the index as assigned by the index provider

ROW.CELL: Country of the financial derivative instrument
Maturity date of the financial derivative instrument
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
Exposure of the financial derivative instrument
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Exposure of the financial derivative instrument
Market value of the financial derivative instrument
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Market value of the financial derivative instrument
Market value of the collateral received (in relation to the financial derivative instrument)
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Market value of the collateral received (in relation to the financial derivative instrument)
Provide the next interest rate reset date (as mentioned in Art 10(2) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131)
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD

CELL.HT: If the type of other asset is a unit or share of other MMF, complete the fields A.6.61 to A.6.71

ROW.CELL: Asset description of the unit or share of other MMF
ISIN of the unit or share of other MMF
LEI (if the ISIN is not available) of the unit or share of other MMF
CFI code (if available and if the ISIN is not available) of the unit or share of other MMF
Country of the unit or share of other MMF
Market value of the unit or share of other MMF
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Market value of unit or share of other MMF
Price of the unit or share of other MMF (NAV per unit or share of other MMF)
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Price of the unit or share of other MMF (NAV per unit or share of other MMF)

CELL.HT: If the type of other asset is a deposit or ancillary liquid assets, complete the fields A.6.72 to A.6.81

ROW.CELL: Asset description of the deposit or ancillary liquid assets
ISIN of the deposit or ancillary liquid assets
CFI (if available and if the ISIN is not available) of the deposit or ancillary liquid assets
Country of the deposit or ancillary liquid assets
Maturity date of the deposit or ancillary liquid assets
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
Exposure of the deposit or ancillary liquid assets
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Exposure of the deposit or ancillary liquid assets

CELL.HT: If the type of other asset is a repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement assets, complete the fields A.6.82 to A.6.99

ROW.CELL: Asset description of the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement
ISIN of the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement
CFI (if available and if the ISIN is not available) of the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement
Country of the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement

CELL.P: The counterparty category shall be selected among the following ones (please see Art 20(2)(e) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131) [Select one]
EU Public body (except National Public body)

ROW.CELL: Maturity date of the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
Exposure of the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement (in the case of reverse repurchase agreement, this is the amount of cash provided to the counterparty)
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Exposure of the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement (in the case of reverse repurchase agreement, this is the amount of cash provided to the counterparty)

Market value of the collateral received (in relation to the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement) (the amount of cash received by the MMF as part of repurchase agreements (as referred to in Article 14(d) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131)
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)

Market value of the collateral received (in relation to the repurchase agreement or a reverse repurchase agreement) (the amount of cash received by the MMF as part of repurchase agreements (as referred to in Art 14(d) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131)

Whether the outcome of the internal credit assessment procedure is favourable or unfavourable (for the different liquid transferable securities or (other) money market instruments received as part of a reverse repurchase agreement as referred to in Article 15(6) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131)
In the context of the reverse repurchase agreements and assets referred to in Article 15 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 that were received by the MMF, please indicate:
Market value of these different assets
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Market value of these different assets
In the context of the reverse repurchase agreements, whether there are any assets as referred to in Article 15(6) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 that were received by the MMF

TXT.HT: Information on the liabilities of the MMF
information on the investors – investor concentration

ROW.CELL: Specify the approximate percentage of the MMF's equity that is beneficially owned by the five beneficial owners that have the largest equity interest in the MMF, as a percentage of NAV of the MMF. Look-through to the ultimate beneficial owners where known or possible

TXT.HT: information on the investors – breakdown of investor concentration

ROW.CELL: Specify the breakdown of investor concentration by status of investors (estimate if no precise information available): 1) Professional clients (as defined in Article 4(1)(10) of Directive 2014/65/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council (MiFID 2)) 2) retail clients (as defined in Article 4(1)(11) of Directive 2014/65/EU (MiFID 2))

NP.TXT: Professional clients (as defined in in Article 4(1)(10) of Directive 2014/65/EU (MiFID 2))
Retail clients (as defined in Article 4(1)(11) of Directive 2014/65/EU (MiFID 2))

TXT.HT: information on the investors – geographical breakdown

ROW.CELL: Provide the breakdown of the ownership of units/shares in the MMF by investor group. Look-through to the ultimate beneficial owners where known or possible.
Specify the geographical breakdown of investors by country (estimate if no precise information available)

TXT.HT: Information on investors — subscription and redemption activity

ROW.CELL: State the frequency of investor redemptions. If multiple classes of shares or units, report for the largest share or unit class by NAV. [Select one]
What is the notice period required by investors for redemptions in days
As at the reporting date, what percentage of the MMFs NAV is subject to the following arrangements:
Other arrangements for managing illiquid assets
Net Asset Value of the MMF over the reporting period
(in EUR, including the impact of subscriptions and redemptions) (at the last day of the month)

NP.TXT: Indicate every event in which the price of an asset valued by using the amortised cost method in accordance with the first subparagraph of Article 29(7) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 deviates from the price of that asset calculated in accordance with paragraphs 2, 3 and 4 of Article 29 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 by more than 10 basis points. These fields should be reported for every asset the price of which, by using the amortised cost method, would deviate in such a way.

ROW.CELL: Valuation date (the first day where the event occurs)
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
CFI code (if available and if the ISIN is not available) of the asset
Price (paragraphs 2, 3 and 4 of Article 29 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131) (at the valuation date mentioned in field B.1.1. when the event occurs)
Price (amortised cost method) (at the valuation date mentioned in field B.1.1. when the event occurs)
From the valuation date specified in field B.1.1, state how long the price of an asset valued by using the amortised cost method deviated by more than 10 basis points from the price of that asset
During the period mentioned in field B.1.6, state the average difference between the two values mentioned in field B.1.6
During the period mentioned in field B.1.6., state the minimum price deviation between the two values
During the period mentioned in field B.1.6, state the maximum price deviation between the two values

NP.TXT: Indicate every event in which the constant NAV per unit or share calculated in accordance with paragraphs 1 and 2 of Article 32 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 deviates from the NAV per unit or share calculated in accordance with Article 30 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 by more than 20 basis points.

ROW.CELL: Valuation date (the first day the event occurs)
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
Constant NAV (Article 31 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131) (at the valuation date mentioned in field B.1.10, when the event occurs)
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
Constant NAV (Article 31 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131) (at the valuation date mentioned in field B.1.10, when the event occurs)
NAV (Article 30 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131) (at the valuation date mentioned in field B.1.10, when the event occurs)
(in EUR) (if the base currency is not in EUR the exchange ratio used shall be the rate most recently set by the European Central Bank)
NAV (Article 30 of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131) (at the valuation date mentioned in field B.1.10, when the event occurs)
From the valuation date specified in field B.1.10, state how long did the constant NAV per unit or share calculated deviate from the NAV per unit or share calculated by more than 20 basis points
During the period mentioned in field B.1.15, state the average difference between the two values mentioned on field B.1.15
During the period mentioned in field B.1.15, state the minimum price deviation between the two values
During the period mentioned in field B.1.15, state the maximum price deviation between the two values

NP.TXT: Indicate every event in which a situation mentioned in Article 34(3) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 occurs and the measures taken by the board in accordance with points (a) and (b) of Article 34(1) of that Regulation.

ROW.CELL: ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD
Date when the measure was taken
ISO 8601 date in the format YYYY-MM-DD

Type of measure (Whenever the proportion of weekly maturing assets falls below 30 % of the total assets of the MMF and whenever the net daily redemptions on a single business day exceed 10 % of total assets)

CELL.P: take no immediate action other than correcting the situation where limits referred to in Article 24(1) of Regulation (EU) 2017/1131 are exceeded, in accordance with Article 24(2) of that Regulation

ROW.CELL: Type of measure (Whenever the proportion of weekly maturing assets falls below 10 % of its total assets)
